intro: Galinsogea balbisioides, commonly known as the slenderleaf ironweed, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and ray florets. The plant typically grows in moist, open habitats such as wetlands and prairies. Its leaves are narrow and lance-shaped, with a smooth or slightly hairy surface. Galinsogea balbisioides produces small, yellowish flowers that bloom in late summer, attracting various pollinators.
